page.title: 08AWBRIDGE PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: At{Awbridge Village School}there are roughly 145 children aged between 5 and 11 years. They all start school at 9:10am and leave the premises at 3:35pm. Each pupil is educated for 5 hours a day, five days a week. There are six teachers (one part time), two cleaners, three dining room and three kitchen assistants although meals are not prepared on the premises. The school was first built in 1877 but now there are a lot of modern buildings. The modern extension cost around Â£150,000 and now allows indoor sports. The catchment area is{Awbridge, {Newtown, Timsbury}and{Michelmersh.} This school is representative of a typical Hampshire village school.
